intro: Dendrobium pere-fauriei, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with multiple stems that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often arranged in racemes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in two rows along the stem. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining potting media to prevent root rot.
